snippet: Ernest Moniz, the energy secretary, says it is time to reconsider an export ban that stemmed from the oil embargoes of the 1970s.
abstract: Energy Secretary Ernest Moniz suggests that it may be time for White House to reconsider nation's ban on exporting domestically produced crude oil; says export ban stems from oil embargoes of 1970s, but recent oil drilling in shale rock formations in Texas and North Dakota have produced glut of crude, making restrictions outdated.
lead_paragraph: Ernest Moniz, the energy secretary, says it is time to reconsider an export ban that stemmed from the oil embargoes of the 1970s.

headline.main: Energy Secretary Calls Oil Export Ban Dated
headline.print_headline: Energy Dept. Calls Oil Export Ban Dated

keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
keywords.name: organizations
